column4: amarok uses way too much of my cpu % and lags heaps.. using feisty on a 2ghz core 2 duo w 2gb ram
amarok uses way too much of my cpu % and lags heaps.. using feisty on a dell inspiron 6400 2ghz core 2 duo w 2gb ram
Maybe check out Exaile - it's pretty cool and has most of Amarok;'s features - plus made for GNOME not KDE
Well, I don't think Amarok is particualry pretty, but I hear what your saying... they have a great SVN version you can use with more features...
Are you running network manager on startup?
Preferences -> Sessions -> Startup programs although you should see something in system tray...
When you startup you should be able to click the network mgr icon in tray and select network...
No, it shouldn't but it should pop up networks - it doesn't show you wired/wireless networks?
And you shold also have an option for manual configuration... DO you not have that?
When you startup the first time what does it show?
No, I'm sure you can decribe to me what network mgr tray applet shows upon first startup... If it shows your network you shold be able to select...
Upon first startup? Great then you can just pick wireless, no?
Perhaps enable roaming mode if it isn't already? I'm a little stumped, sorry...
Admin -> Network... select wireless and check it... may already be enabled though...

I'm not positive, but I don't think version in repos supports that... but you have to get the svn version (they have a repo for fesisty) -- check out exaile.org or #exaile for deets... I'm using SVN with my wma files (though it reports the bit rate wrong)...
